reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a wonderful place for a romatic weekend. Very good food and accomodation. The arrangement sensual voyage for lovers is a must. We stayed in the suite Manoriale and it was excellent. A very big room with a tub for 2.
reviews.title: An exciting and relaxing surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 5 wonderful days at this exceptional hotel about 3 miles outside of Spa. The food is on a par with the best we have eaten anywhere else in the World. The Chef takes you on a fabulous journey with each sitting, we had one 6 course meal and two 4 course meals all of which were exceptional. I chose the cheese course as my 6th on the 1st night assuming foolishly that I would get some cheese possibly with some biscuits. How wrong can you be, Chef Olivier Tucki puts as much effort into this course as all the others it was incredible. NOWHERE else I have eaten has ever devoted any time to the cheese course. The surroundings are amazing the staff are brilliant all speak English plus several other languages as usual putting us to shame.
reviews.title: Best in Belgium ? Almost certainly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cost of all this luxury in quite high but you could pay considerably more in the UK and not get close, especially with the food. My only comparison in the UK is The Albannach Hotel in Lochinver, The Monachyle Mhor near Callander and The Three Chimneys in Colbost come close though. If there is a better hotel in Belgium please let me know.
reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are great (get a suite: since you're spending the money anyway, you may as well); the scenery is beautiful; the spa is large and very good quality; and the food and wine, which are definitely the highlight of the whole place, are superb. The service is very attentive, but not intrusive.
reviews.title: I was a princess for a night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really perfect for a relaxing, get-away-from-it weekend. It is expensive, and bear in mind that you will end up spending quite a bit on food and drink as well, but it's a great place to get away from the city and get some country air.
reviews.title: Great hotel - superb food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Manoir de Lebioles is a beautiful small early 20th century castle in the Ardennes. The rooms are large, comfortable, well-decorated; one odd touch is the glass door fronting the toilet (why glass?) but as the bathroom area as a whole can be closed off, it's no big deal. Lovely views of wooded hills and fields; no real neighbors. What sets Lebioles apart is the restaurant: truly inspired, inventive, delicious food served generously in a comfortable, calm dining room that's usually full but with tables spaced far apart so all you hear is a convivial hum of conversation. Expensive but well-selected wine list with lots of biodynamic choices. The hotel may be a bit understaffed, and that goes for the dining room too - waits are sometimes a bit long and the staff are correct but seem a bit distracted at times. Breakfast - oddly - is not to the same standard; it's pretty good but not especially creative or special. The spa is pretty, but crowded, and the expensive massage I had was more like a light stroking even after I asked for strong (sports) pressure - don't bother with it.
reviews.title: Come for the food, stay for the room

reviews.text: This nineteenth's century manor was restored to offer modern, sophisticated and top comfort amenities.
reviews.title: nineteenth & modern annuities for a restful time in Belgian Ardennes

reviews.text: I stayed at the manoir twice, the first time ca. 2 years ago and the last time in spring 2010.
reviews.title: Great for a romantic get-away

reviews.text: It's somewhat hard to find, so make sure you have a navigation system. The first time I came, the Domaine de Lebioles wasn't even in the SatNav and we had to ask for the way repeatedly. Don't rely on signs, it's impossible to find without clear directions.
reviews.title: Incredibly beautifull and great food

reviews.text: The area is beautiful, all forest around, great for walks, hikes, or jogging (easy to get lost though, happened to me). When driving up to the manoir it's a magnificent sight, elegant, royal, posh. I find the property itself absolutely impeccable, modernly art-deco-style renovated inside, topnotch technology (flatscreens, DVD players, designer-bathrooms). The new spa is great, they have a steamroom, a sauna and a pool, beautifully designed.
reviews.title: Nice castle in Spa

reviews.text: Service is not very good, apart from the warm welcome. The spa was unattended, and despite we asked for spa treatments at check-in (they said to check back in the morning cause the "lady" was gone), nobody was there the next day either. The owner was present, but did not care to interact with the guests. The restaurant is closed during the week.
reviews.title: No worth the effort to find the place

reviews.title: Our third perfect experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the Hotel Restaurant on our 1st night. The Restaurant is small and intimate, my only criticism is that the tables were quite close together- whether this was because it was a busy weekend in the hotel, I don't know. The food was of an exceptional standard- but be warned, if you like plain, simple food the menu won't be for you. One of the things on the menu during our stay were sweetbreads...not for everyones pallet!
reviews.title: Pricey but worth the splurge!
